etymologies: Old English dæges ēage ‘day's eye’ (because the flower opens in the morning and closes at night)

definitions: a small grassland plant that has flowers with a yellow disk and white rays. It has given rise to many ornamental garden varieties.

notes.text: Bellis perennis, family Compositae (or Asteraceae; the daisy family). The plants of this large family (known as composites) are distinguished by having composite flower heads consisting of numerous disk florets, ray florets, or both; they include many weeds (dandelions, thistles, ragworts) and garden flowers (asters, chrysanthemums, dahlias, marigolds)

shortDefinitions: small European grassland plant which has flowers with yellow disc

definitions: used in names of other plants with flowers similar to the daisy, e.g., Michaelmas daisy, Shasta daisy.
shortDefinitions: used in names of other plants of same family
